p: The gastric pH of stomach contents significantly ( p ˂ 0.01) decreased after the induction of gastric ulcers. Gastric pH of G1 (2.33 ± 0.320) and G3 (2.31 ± 1.860) was nonsignificantly ( p > .05) different from each other. Omeprazole improved stomach pH in G3 as compared to the positive control group G2 (1.31 ± 0.017). It correlates with the study of Bhajoni et al. ( 2016) who assessed the anti‐ulcer effect of aqueous extract of leaves of A. indica on gastric ulcer using gastric pH as a biomarker. Extract of A. indica helped in attenuating raised gastric pH due to aspirin, pyloric ligation, and cold‐restraint stress‐induced gastric ulcer and exhibited potential anti‐ulcer properties.
